meta_data.title: Motif-consistent Counterfactual Data Generation with Adversarial Refinement for Graph-level Anomaly Detection
meta_data.abstract: In this paper, we propose a novel framework, \modelname, for graph-level anomaly detection. Our approach introduces the concept of motif-consistent counterfactual data generation combined with adversarial refinement to address traditional challenges in graph data. We employ a graph producer and a GAN-based optimizer to generate high-quality counterfactual graphs that enhance model generalization across varying environments. Extensive experiments demonstrate the superiority of our proposed approach over state-of-the-art baselines on benchmark datasets.
meta_data.method name: Motif-consistent Counterfactual Data Generation with Adversarial Refinement

relate work.related papers: Manzoor, E., et al., Hooi, B., et al., Zhao, P., et al., Ma, X., et al.
relate work.comparisons with related methods:
1. Compared to graph kernel methods which rely heavily on graph structural similarities, our approach leverages motif-level features that are central to anomaly detection efficiency.
2. Unlike traditional shallow learning techniques, our method incorporates deep learning and adversarial strategies ensuring robustness in anomaly detection tasks.
3. The proposed GAN-based optimizer stands out by refining generated graphs to maintain motif consistency, a feature not prevalent in most counterfactual augmentation methods.

high_level_summary.summary of this paper: This paper introduces \modelname, a framework designed to optimize graph-level anomaly detection through counterfactual data generation. By integrating motifs and adversarial refinement, the model enhances detection and generalization across varied datasets.
high_level_summary.research purpose: To develop an optimized framework for graph-level anomaly detection utilizing counterfactual data generation.
high_level_summary.research challenge: Traditional graph-level anomaly detection methods struggle with dataset-dependent spurious correlations and often produce suboptimal results especially in new datasets.
high_level_summary.method summary: \modelname includes a graph producer for generating raw counterfactual graphs and a GAN-based optimizer to refine them, ensuring they satisfy key counterfactual properties like realism and validity.
high_level_summary.conclusion: The experiments demonstrate \modelname's ability to significantly enhance detection and model generalization, outperforming existing state-of-the-art techniques.

Method.description: The proposed method consists of two core components: the raw counterfactual graph producer and a GAN-based graph optimizer. The producer combines different graph motifs to produce counterfactual samples. The optimizer refines them using adversarial strategies, ensuring they meet essential counterfactual properties.
Method.problem formultaion: The graph-level anomaly detection problem is defined as identifying graphs within a set that differ significantly in structure, using few anomalous labels.
Method.feature processing: Involves extracting motifs, core subgraphs that determine graph categories, for further analysis and counterfactual generation.
Method.model: A GAN-based framework that generates and refines counterfactual graphs with motif consistency and tailored losses allowing for robust detection across datasets.
Method.theoretical analysis: The GAN-based approach ensures refined counterfactual graphs meet properties of realism, validity, proximity, and sparsity, vital for overcoming spurious correlations.
Method.complexity: The computational overhead is comparable to general GAN-based systems, focusing on the optimization of graph distributions for effective training.
Method.algorithm step: Raw graphs are generated by combining motifs and environments from input graphs; refined using a GAN structure ensuring consistent motif information and minimized distortions.

Experiments.setup: Experiments conducted on an Ubuntu server using predefined datasets split into training, validation, and testing sets following existing studies.
Experiments.hyperparameters: Set standard configurations for learning rate (0.001), dropout rate (0.5-0.8), lambda values balancing loss components (1.0, 0.9, 0.6).
Experiments.results: \modelname consistently outperformed baselines across multiple datasets, achieving superior detection rates especially on denser graph structures.
Experiments.performance: Demonstrated significant improvements in F1 scores, validating the method's efficiency.
Experiments.analysis: Showed enhanced model generalization due to robust counterfactual generation and refinement strategies.
Experiments.ablation study: Confirmed key component significance, notably motif consistency and GAN-based refinement, in bolstering anomaly detection.

conclusion.summary: \modelname effectively leverages counterfactual data generation and motif consistency to improve graph-level anomaly detection, outperforming current state-of-the-art models.
conclusion.future work: Future investigations aim to optimize computational efficiency and extend the model's capabilities in evolving graph anomaly scenarios.
